description: While relatively low in value, flawed veltecite is still valuable enough to be worth taking a pickaxe to some rocks.
Shards of Cloudy Veltecite are often used for energy storage and generation. Korolev are always looking for any that prospectors can mine.
A rare shard of clear Veltecite. Korolev will pay a decent bit of pocket money for any that prospectors uncover with their pickaxes.
Very rare shard of pure Veltecite torn out of a mineral vein, highly valued by Korolev and others.
The 'heart' of a veltecite vein, from which pure and common veltecite grows out of like roots reaching upwards to the surface. Incredibly rare and highly coveted.

Main-Osiris-CraftFuel-2.inGameName: Building a better Death Ray Part 2

description: Growths of these crystals are common on Fortuna III, valuable on the station for where they're often used in the creation of miniature figures.

Perk_HealthRegen_Storm.inGameName: Health restoration per second during a Storm

description: Growths of these crystals are common on Fortuna III, valuable on the station for where they're often used in the creation of miniature figures.
Found in various mineral veins pushed to the surface by the same process that spawns veltecite, this material is still worth mining.
Found in various mineral veins pushed to the surface by the same process that spawns veltecite, this ore seems to have been affected by proximity with the rare crystals.
Rare crystal, is of scientific interest and can be sold for K-Marks.
Somewhat common on H-C5 planets, Titan Ore was essential during the initial colonization. Still used in a variety of printing and upgrading processes.
Somewhat common on H-C5 planets, Titan Ore was essential during the initial colonization. Still used in a variety of printing and upgrading processes.

Perk_AIProtection.inGameName: Less damage from hostile fauna attacks

description: Good for selling and desired by Osiris for their rare properties. Also tastes good, if prepared properly.

Main-Osiris-SideWork1-1.inGameName: The Needs of the One Part 1

description: Rare radioactive crystal, retrieved from debris of Fortuna III's cracked moon. Extremely valuable.

Perk_WeightAll.inGameName: Reduced weight of all items carried in backpack

description: Rare radioactive crystal, retrieved from debris of Fortuna III's cracked moon. Highly valuable.

Perk_ItemWeightReduction.inGameName: Reduced weight of this piece of gear

description: Blue Runner eggs have a notoriously thick shell, allowing them to only care for the eggs when close to hatching. Can be sold on the station.
A collection of metal alloys used as a base material in many items, ready to slot into compatible printers.
Material used in a variety of printing and upgrading processes.
Perfectly polished, lenses like these often find themselves used more in high-powered cutting machinery than in actual optic equipment.
Fortuna III's settlers took to using explosives to both mold the environment to their liking and get rid of the local pests. Can still be sold on the station, for fireworks of course.
One of those 'miracle materials', sheets of this stuff is commonly used in the printing of various tools, machinery, and of course, weapons.
Standardized metal and plastic sheets like these are used to print everything from tractors to weapons, so long as you follow the right printing instructions.
Useful for printing weapons and beacons. The tech may be hundreds of years old, but if it works, it works.
Helps keep things pointing where they're supposed to be pointing even in the roughest conditions, making it quite useful for printing some weapon components.
A simple mechanical component used to print a multitude of machines with moving parts, such as firearms.
Can be loaded into most printers to print the base components of almost anything, from rubber ducks to weapon parts.
These used to be able print, repair, and manipulate simple machinery and electronics. Might still be useful if repaired or used for parts.
A delicate yet powerful machine used for printing certain items.
Made for crunching through large datasets, used in several devices that require large amounts of simple calculations.
An advanced CPU, ideal for the running of adaptive AI systems or the manipulation of complex energy fields.
Useful for printing equipment with high power requirements. DO NOT DISASSEMBLE. DO NOT ATTEMPT TO REPAIR. IF DAMAGED, DISPOSE OF AS INSTRUCTED IN FIG-24B.

Perk_StaminaRegenDelay_Storm.inGameName: Stamina regenerates without delay during a Storm

Perk_WeightAll.inGameName: Reduced weight of all items carried in backpack

description: A component used for certain weapons with heavy recoil.
Used for printing a variety of equipment requiring regular charges, such as weapons.
A component necessary for certain weapons with high power usage.
Interactive Screens were common among civilians on Fortuna III, used for all sorts of purposes. Cached data and basic components give them some selling value.
Currency used on Fortuna III before the evacuations. Still in use by some on Prospect Station.
A rare glowy mushroom that can only be harvested during the storm on Fortuna. Highly coveted by Osiris.

Main-Osiris-CraftFuel-1.inGameName: Building a better Death Ray Part 1

Perk_HealthRegen_Storm.inGameName: Health restoration per second during a Storm

description: Azure Trees are found sprinkled around the less shaded areas of Fortuna III, with their bark coveted for artisanal goods.

Main-Osiris-SideWork1-1.inGameName: The Needs of the One Part 1

description: The pollen filament of a Waterweed, a plant that can only be harvested around water bodies such as lakes or swamps on Fortuna III. The blossoms themselves are worthless, but these Filaments fetch a decent price on Prospect Station.

Main-Osiris-SideWork1-2.inGameName: The Needs of the One Part 2

Perk_ItemWeightReduction.inGameName: Reduced weight of this piece of gear

description: This lonely weed grows in open, arid areas on Fortuna III and develops valuable vibrant blossoms when exposed to direct sunlight.

Main-Osiris-SideWork1-4.inGameName: The Needs of the One Part 4

Main-Osiris-CraftFuel-1.inGameName: Building a better Death Ray Part 1

Perk_WeightFaunaResources.inGameName: Reduced weight of minerals and creature parts carried in backpack

description: The blossom of Pale Ivy, a strange plant that likes to climb up walls to keep its gorgeous, divinely smelling petals out of the reach of critters and insects.

Perk_HealingAmount.inGameName: Bonus to Stim and Medkit healing

Perk_HealthRegen_Storm.inGameName: Health restoration per second during a Storm

description: Tastes delicious, and can be processed to gain some useful chemicals.

Perk_ItemWeightReduction.inGameName: Reduced weight of this piece of gear

Perk_WeightFaunaResources.inGameName: Reduced weight of minerals and creature parts carried in backpack

description: Heavy and durable fabrics, useful for printing various items.  You can never get the smell of mildew out of these.
A bundle of cables, still in good condition.  Unfortunately not platinum plated, unsuitable for true audio transmission.
Even outside of its intended purpose, the materials still have various uses in item printing.  Yes, it's asbestos.
Still the best bang for the buck for electric cables, makes for a good and cheap electric conductor.
Adaptable material, used for printing various items.  Also a fun art tool!
An old circuit board, its components can be salvaged and repurposed to build new items.  And now you can put e-waste management on your resume.
An old colonial radio transceiver; salvaging these for item printing is cheaper than buying new parts.
Medicine left behind on the planet, can be processed to make new supplies.  Fortuna's colonists definitely had a lot of pills...
A full lab in a box, also contains all sorts of specialized equipment and materials that can be repurposed.  Loaded with delicate tools, sensitive software, and no manual.
A pack of high-powered, slightly radioactive batteries. Safe to use in most electronic devices.  Not actually fusion powered, but still worryingly radioactive.
A powerful and sweet smelling chemical, can be processed to help manufacture other items.  Don't ingest within 6 hours of consuming any fruits or nuts. Or ideally ever.

Main-Osiris-SideWork1-1.inGameName: The Needs of the One Part 1

Main-Osiris-CraftFuel-1.inGameName: Building a better Death Ray Part 1

description: A portable device used for collecting biological samples in the field. Can be used to assist with printing delicate items.  This model incorporates a pressure-activated injector as well. Mildly concerning.
A small crate of miscellaneous medical supplies, has all sorts of chemicals useful for printing new items.  There are A LOT of warning labels here.
Nutrion's flagship product, a full day's meal in a single candy bar.
A simple and easy way to carry one's riches and memories.  Also very easy to lose during an emergency evacuation.
A sealed self-powered container for exotic alien samples.  Scientists are always putting little things in jars and hoping for the best.
Mostly aluminum and steel; not the most valuable salvage, but useful for printing.
Wanted for several rare materials easily harvested from the spine, as well as for research by those looking into the origins of Fortuna III's hostile creatures.
The base of the spine of a hostile Fortuna III creature affected by the Cycle. Contains some useful materials for various items or research.

Main-Osiris-CraftFuel-2.inGameName: Building a better Death Ray Part 2

Perk_HealthRegen_Storm.inGameName: Health restoration per second during a Storm

Perk_StaminaRegenDelay_Storm.inGameName: Stamina regenerates without delay during a Storm

description: The foul smelling sack some creatures use to produce compounds capable of breaking down common synthetic materials, nevermind human flesh.

Perk_AIDetection.inGameName: Hostile fauna is less aggressive towards the wearer

description: The torn off head of a dead Strider.  Careful, it can still bite!
The torn off head of a dead Rattler.  Corrosive drool everywhere, handle with gloves.

Perk_AIProtection.inGameName: Less damage from hostile fauna attacks

Perk_HunterVisionHelm.inGameName: Enhanced Alien Hunter Vision which consumes stamina (can be toggled on/off)

Perk_AIDetection.inGameName: Hostile fauna is less aggressive towards the wearer

description: The torn off head of a dead Marauder.  The eyes still follow you around. Creepy.

Perk_HunterVisionHelm.inGameName: Enhanced Alien Hunter Vision which consumes stamina (can be toggled on/off)

description: The torn off head of a dead Crusher.  It's even uglier up close... Still, a fine trophy!
It doesn't seem to have any real practical purpose, but this trophy is one of the most desired items Fortuna III produces.
A chunk of Strider flesh. Presumably of a dead one.  You know, if you cook it properly it's actually pretty good.

Main-Osiris-SideWork1-2.inGameName: The Needs of the One Part 2

description: The eyes of a dead Rattler.  Well, hopefully it was dead, anyway...

Perk_AIDetection.inGameName: Hostile fauna is less aggressive towards the wearer

description: A chunk of Marauder flesh.  It moves if you poke it.

Perk_AIDetection.inGameName: Hostile fauna is less aggressive towards the wearer

description: A chunk of Crusher flesh.  Even its meat is hard as bone.
Taken off a skinned Rattler.  Fashionable! Just don't think about where it came from.
Dropped from some of Fortuna III's toughest creatures, can be used for printing certain items after refining.

Main-Osiris-SideWork1-3.inGameName: The Needs of the One Part 3

Perk_AIProtection.inGameName: Less damage from hostile fauna attacks

description: Taken off a skinned Crusher.  (read: hacked repeatedly until something fell off)
The heart of an Alpha Crusher, or at least chunks of it, can be used for several almost miraculous medical treatments. It's also a local delicacy, for those with more money than sense.
Multi purpose tool, handy for sticking things together or providing flexible insulation.  The warning label says to not use if you need a warning label.
Rewarded by Korolev, required for upgrades to your Quarters' Stash and Safe Pockets.
Rewarded by Osiris, required for upgrades to your Quarters' K-Mark and Aurum generators.
Rewarded by the ICA, required for upgrades to your Quarters' Supply Crate Generator and Gear Printer.
Solidified mass of Letium, rare and valuable.
A pressured cannister filled with concentrated Nanite-infused Crude. It reacts to the storm radiation in strange ways.  Almost looks like it's alive, moving and swirling on its own.
A chunk of flesh from a Heavy Strider.  Tougher than normal Strider meat, it barely bleeds.
The eyes of a dead Mature Rattler.  Age only improved the thing's sight...

Perk_AIProtection.inGameName: Less damage from hostile fauna attacks

description: A chunk of Savage Marauder flesh.  Burns if you touch it without gloves.
The torn off head of a dead Heavy Strider.  Far too ugly to mount on a wall.
The torn off head of a dead Mature Rattler.  These things do NOT age gracefully...
The torn off head of a dead Savage Marauder.  It's still blinking. Menacingly.
One of the deadly projectiles Howlers use to skewer prey from a distance. This one was still not fully formed and can be harvested for useful materials. Worth some coin to the right people.
A damaged gland ripped out of a dead Howler. Used by the creatures to excrete several compounds and pheromones, commonly referred to as 'honey'; the organ alone is in high demand.
Known as the 'Honey Gland', this organ is still capable of producing someo of the valued honey-like substance Howlers use to attract and dominate other creatures. Very valuable.
Effectively the 'vocal cords' that Howlers use to emit their iconic screams. Reaches a high price on the station.
The sound emitting organ of a dead Howler, removed in one whole neat piece. The intricacies of its 'construction' make it very valuable.

An encased glob of Howler 'honey', the sticky substance the creatures use to affect other creatures, and as sustenance for their young. It's been found to be highly nutritious, sweet, and have almost mythical regenerative properties. Of course, it's also extremely addictive with a lethal withdrawal.
A solid clump of inert ancient nanites fused with iron, along with various other elements trapped within when the mass solidified.
A small mass of inert nanites mixed with elemental iron and few other metals. The composite structure is almost perfect.
A well shaped ingot made with Tharis Iron. Harder and heavier than anything else you have ever felt. Slightly warm to the touch.

An ingot made of Pure Tharis Iron somehow charged with storm lightning. Sometimes lets off a shock when touched, and you can hear a buzz if you put it next to your ear.  OSIRIS ADVISORY: Do not any under circumstances interact with this material without Class T protective gear!

An ingot made of Pure Tharis Iron, heavily charged with storm lightning. Just touching it leaves your fingers numb.  OSIRIS ADVISORY: Do not any under circumstances interact with this material without Class T protective gear!
Extracted from a glowing Teratomorphic Crystal, just holding this in your bag gives you an uneasy feeling.
Refuse from some unknown process. Not very useful, but still fetches a high price on the station by alien artefact collectors and admirers of rare art.
A sphere of processed and activated Tharis Iron impossibly locked in place.   Gives an aura of infinite potential.
A unique plant so far only found on Tharis Island. Nothing about it feels right...

Perk_HealingAmount.inGameName: Bonus to Stim and Medkit healing

description: A clearly alien material, the Progenitors built their monuments on Fortuna III with this. Could possibly be used to build other things, as well.

Perk_WeightConsumablesAmmo.inGameName: Reduced weight of ammo and consumables carried in backpack

Perk_WeightWeaponGear.inGameName: Reduced weight of weapons and gear carried in backpack

description: A powerful locator that can be used to call down a Korolev Laser Drill Platform on Extreme Letium Veins.
A data drive. Data can be improved at an Uplink, or the drive exchanged for K-Marks.
A data drive with some interesting information. Data can be improved at an Uplink, or the drive exchanged for K-Marks.
A data drive with rare information. Data can be improved at an Uplink, or the drive exchanged for K-Marks.
A data drive with valuable information. Data can be improved at an Uplink, or the drive exchanged for K-Marks.
A data drive with highly valuable and unique information. Can be exchanged for K-Marks.
A data drive carrying information on the Bright Sands Dig Site.
Used for opening the Elite Crusher Caverns, highly charged Osiris laser gets fired at location of this beacon.
A powerful locator that can be used to call down an ICA NiC pump and refiner on an oil deposit.
Camera belonging to a 'Jamie Faulkner'. The last video file is damaged, but the audio is of a large crowd demanding to be let in' before suddenly cutting off. '

Owner named only as 'Temporary'. Last video shows several workers running out barricaded buildings and towards a clearing with a guarded ship being loaded with ore. Video cuts off after the owner appears to trip and fall.

Camera belonging to a 'Mayumi S. Nagao'. Video shows her being pushed out of a cargo ship by a Korolev Heavy Trooper and falling into the mud. Video cuts off shortly after an eruption of gunfire is heard around her.
An engineer's helmet caked in Letium. The embedded sensors may have recorded something important.
A container preserving... something. A label on the side states: 'WARNING: HIGH LETIUM CONTENT, DO NOT SHAKE'
Part of the system that manages the Drill. Hopefully it can be reconfigured to safely mine for Letium.

inGameName: Sign of Life from Stranded Prospector
description: A photo of Marie and a prospector named Tao. Rare to see paper photographs anymore, it must have meant a lot to the owner.
Personal data tablet with theoretical research on powering energy generators with fragments from Fortuna's moon. The power output of a single working 'Fireball generator would be revolutionary. '

Data on the first prototype for 'Project Fireball'. Yields under safe conditions were underwhelming, with warnings of an uncontrollable chain reaction if pushed too hard without further research. Might explain why there's a giant hole in the moon...  Final notes suggest switching resources to look into 'NiC'.
One of the few remaining components from an old oil pump that still looks to be in working condition.
Belonging to a long dead creature, damage has exposed metalic elements that seemed to have formed after death.
The tooth of a now extinct massive beast once common on Fortuna III. Parts of it seem to have unnatural grooves and geometric shapes.
A cargo ship's flight recorder, only slightly damaged. Highly encrypted and beyond your suit's ability to access.

An Osiris researcher's notebook. It's seen better days. Full of formulas, drawings, and long paragraphs regarding the unnatural evolution and mutations of Fortuna III's fauna caused by Progenitor terraformers.

An off the record log of some of the events that occurred on Tharis island. While badly damaged, and much of it is in short hand, what's evident is Korolev ran into serious issues in the caverns: several reports of miners going missing, pervasive malaise, multiple accidents...  The operation's foreman clearly had little regard for workplace safety.
A collected sample of a rare composite material found in the Tharis Caverns
A tagged nugget of a rare composite material found in the Tharis Caverns. Denser and with next to no impurities than most samples.

A collection of medical reports from the Korolev team working the caverns. Initial incidents involved exhaustion and minor injuries, but later reports focus on mental clouding, hallucinations, loss of time...  Symptoms appear identical to those of prolonged exposure to the Teratomorphic Energy Field that now envelops most of Fortuna III.

A folder kept by Gregor Kazan, the Head of Operations for Korolev when the storms hit Fortuna III decades ago. It appears he intentionally kept all reports and findings from the Tharis operations off the system, though the reason for that isn't explained, nor is how the folder ended up on the island.  Worryingly, official records state less than 50 Korolev employees ever worked in the caverns, while these files list several hundred.
A chunky old data drive. Might have some valuable info, if it still works.
A Korolev data drive. Appears to have been used as a blunt instrument. Has definitely seen better days.

A crystaline chunk with various cables and circuit boards haphazardly strapped on to it.  It's impossible to tell if the mind that created this had something utilitarian in mind, or if this creation is simply a form of religious 'art'.
Some sort of cultist fetish, featuring a clump of Tharis Iron and a sigil or diagram of some kind. Maybe they venerated the alien material? Or it's just a symbol for the caverns themselves?

An old sheet of paper with various drawings and pictograms laid out as simple formulas, all but one scratched out.  The same trident-like drawing found on previous cultist items features prominently here.
An old mini-comm and some personal items. Whoever this belonged to likely didn't work on the island.
A map liberated from an abandoned Osiris outpost. Shows the layout of the Tharis caverns, including several areas marked as high-interest.
An ancient video recording device, probably fashionable in some retro circles. Amazingly it actually powered on, though only for a few seconds.
A loose bit from the strange door in one of the Osiris installations on Tharis Island.  The door itself seems impenetrable, far more robust than what Osiris is known for building.
An old Osiris portable lab, still in working condition. Surely nobody will mind giving it a new home and purpose...
Recovered off the body of an Osiris engineer in Tharis Caverns, appears to have been mapping out potential research locations when they met with a terrible fate.

A damaged Osiris researcher helmet, these always carry their own camera and data storage.  Fortunately, whatever it was that did short work of its wearer managed to avoid breaking any of the valuable bits.
A common drone used by journalists and photographers. Appears to have been in hover mode over its owner until recently.

Data drive from a Korolev security camera. It shows a giant creature viciously attacking a pair of prospectors second after their pods landed. Given your basic knowledge of anatomy, mainly in regards to how many litres of blood an adult has in them, it seems extremely unlikely they survived.

A collection of 'tips' on avoiding and fighting the creature known as 'Howler'. It warns against moving when the creature 'screams', and to aim for its belly when possible. Avoiding the beast altogether is listed as the best strategy, something the tip-maker failed to do.
A dossier full of old reports and photos that place previous Howler sightings near Korolev mining sites, usually immediately after a blasting or wall breach.

A more detailed report on past Howler sighting Korolev covered. Whether or not Howler appearances were caused by Korolev mining is not confirmed, but at the time the corp certainly believed so, and went out of their way to keep all the data they collected off-network.
Broken and mangled, with some beast's claw still lodged in it. Few creatures are able to deal this much damage. Osiris will want to analyse this.
Appears to be the organ the howling beasts use to echolocate targets. You're unsure why this was in one of its nests... perhaps molting? Or part of a grim mating ritual?
Schematics for a new kind of non-lethal grenade, aimed at simulating weapons fire.
The recipe required to create stronger med stims. Very few of these components sound safe to ever be near living tissue.
Sample of a flower native to Fortuna III. While this plant could theoretically survive on Bright Sands, it's very unlikely it originated from here.

Old Osiris research documents, focussed on a new rare crystaline structure. Likely pilfered from an Osiris research lab or lost in the evacuations, it's unlikely the research would have been carried out at the Favela.
Cheap ammo for pistols and submachine guns. Compatible weapons: K-28, S-576 PDW, Scarab, KM-9 'Scrapper'.
Standard issue assault rifle ammo. Compatible weapons: AR-55 Autorifle, Manticore.
Standard issue sniper rifle ammo. Compatible weapons: C-32 Bolt Action.
Standard issue shotgun ammo. Compatible weapons: B9 Trenchgun, Bulldog.
Rusty old times ammo cartridge. It is safe to sell it or throw it away.
Advanced ammo for assault rifles and light machine guns. Compatible weapons: ICA Guarantee, Phasic Lancer.
Advanced ammo for sniper and designated marksman rifles. Compatible weapons: Lacerator, KBR-Longshot.
Advanced shotgun ammo. Compatible weapons: PKR Maelstrom, Shattergun.
Ultimate ammo for pistols and submachine guns. Compatible weapons: Asp Flechette Gun, Hammer, Voltaic Brute.
Ultimate assault rifle ammo. Compatible weapons: Advocate, Gorgon, KOR-47.
Ultimate ammo for sniper and designated marksman rifles. Compatible weapons: Basilisk, Kinetic Arbiter, KARMA-1.
Specialist ammo for KOMRAD grenade launcher.
Specialist ammo for ZEUS beam LMG.
A heavy pistol that can inflict devastating damage, at the cost of any kind of subtlety. Audible range: 400m
A semi-automatic shotgun; heavy and a poor choice at range, but utterly devastating up close. Audible range: 350m
A rapid-firing shard SMG; a good choice for taking out targets at close range, though of little use in long range engagements. Audible range: 350m
Heavy assault rifle. Lower rate of fire than others in its class, but packs a punch. Audible range: 400m
A marksman rifle with good accuracy and power. Excels in medium range engagements. Audible range: 450m
While heavy and requiring a charge-up to fire, a direct hit from will cripple if not outright kill almost any target. Audible range: 500m
A powerful shotgun pistol that suffers from very limited range. Audible range: 300m
An unconventional shotgun that fires shard fragments by shattering an unstable fuel crystal. Audible range: 350m
An SMG with high versatility in its effective range. Audible range: 350m
A fast firing phase LMG, perfect for pinning down targets. Audible range: 400m
A dependable assault rifle that offers a good balance between accuracy and rate of fire. Audible range: 400m
A capable marksman rifle, has a decent fire rate, accuracy, and good handling. Audible range: 450m
A gauss sniper rifle that fires metal rods at immense velocity. Favored among Prospectors that want to resolve issues quickly quickly and from a safe distance. Audible range: 500m
A standard semi-automatic pistol. An effective sidearm for any Prospector. Audible range: 300m
Pump-action shotgun with high-spread and short range. Yep, it's a shotgun, all right. Audible range: 350m
A popular SMG with high rate of fire, formidable at close range. Audible range: 350m
A decent fully automatic rifle; doesn't excel in any one department, but it's effective and versatile. Audible range: 400m
Bolt action sniper rifle that was commonly used by colonists. Accurate and dependable. Audible range: 500m
Rusty Pump-action shotgun, high-spread, short range. Just a bit damaged. Audible range: 350m
A rusty used SMG with high rate of fire, still has some worth in close range engagements. Audible range: 350m
A rusty automatic rifle, doesn't seem to excel anymore. Audible range: 400m
A dependable pistol, fires in controlled and powerful three-shot bursts. Audible range: 300m
Lightweight SMG. A formidable automatic weapon for close range encounters. Audible range: 350m
A burst rifle that fires in accurate 3-shot bursts, effective against most threats a Prospector might encounter. Audible range: 400m
A powerful beam rifle that needs charging up to fire. Not the easiest to handle, but lethal in proper hands. Audible range: 350m
A flechette assault rifle; it's heavy hitting, but less accurate compared to similar rifles. Audible range: 400m
A phase tech marksman rifle; the impacts are powerful for its class, and it boasts a high rate of fire. Audible range: 450m
While able to neutralize heavily armored targets, the KARLA howitzer is unwieldy and suffers from a low rate of fire.
This fearsome weapon is fires salvos of fast-moving missiles capable of making short work of near any hostile element. Audible range: 500m
A standard grenade launcher with a high damage output; it requires skilled use to operate efficiently.

A slow firing launcher, projectiles create a harming energy field on impact. Further discharges of the launcher into an active field feed into it, until reaching a critical point resulting in a devastating release of energy.
Called 'Zeus' for turning any mortal into the God of Lightning, it can fulminate any creature that meets your divine ire. Audible range: 350m
An old rusty semi-automatic pistol. Its glory days are over. Audible range: 300m
The Harbinger Expeditionary Corps. variant of the Manticore, more powerful than the civilian Manticore available for sale. Audible range: 400m
A less powerful version of the Guarantee, originally intended for when more conventional methods of pest control  were not enough. Audible range: 400m
An improved version of the standard Scarab Adaptive Phase Pistol, custom built for the Osiris Harbinger Expeditionary Corps. A rare find, worth keeping hold of. Audible range: 300m
An improved version of the S-576, meant for use by colony security forces before the surface was abandoned.  Audible range: 350m

A contraband version of the AR-55, originally intended for use in the Demia Rebellion. More powerful than the mass produced version CoTEC would later sell to various frontier worlds. Audible range: 400m
And older version of the KBR used by Korolev's on-site security forces. Audible range: 450m
A civilian security issue Asp. Not as powerful as the standard Osiris version, it's still a competent SMG.  Audible range: 350m
An older version of the Hammer, popular among colonists before the storms. Packs less of a punch, but still a beast. Audible range: 400m
One of various KARMA prototypes Korolev built on Fortuna III. Features a less powerful battery than the KARMA-1 release version. Audible range: 500m
An older prototype version of the mighty Zeus. Still capable of fulminating most targets. Audible range: 350m
A more powerful variant of the C-32 used by Sentinels to keep the peace outside the old settled areas. Audible range: 500m
Fast application. Provides a slight health boost.
Fast application. Provides a small health boost.
Slow application. Provides a great health boost.
Fast application. Provides a moderate health boost.
Slow application. Provides a massive health boost.
Slow application. Provides a full health boost.
A non-lethal grenade that covers an area in thick smoke.
A grenade that covers an area in lethal poisonous gas.
A small device that emits the sounds of fake gunfire to distract enemies.
A thrown explosive device that detonates after a short delay.
A thrown explosive device that detonates after a short delay.
A thrown explosive device that detonates after a short delay.
A thrown device, developed by Osiris, that detonates after a short delay and disorients and slows targets in a radius.
Labeled only as 'Servers - Bright Sands', with the Com-Base logo.
Appears to be for one of the mine entrances along the northern edge of Bright Sands.
A generic keycard, someone drew a house on stilts on the back.
Keycard carrying the 'Asclepius Vaccines' logo. And several biohazard warnings... may want to wash your hands.
Decades of swampy grime have eaten away at the keycard's cover, but someone scratched 'SKELETON' onto it with a knife. Hopefully still works.
The keycard is pretty scratched up, and might have been part of some creature's meal, but you can still see the words 'Jungle Outpost' at the top.
The key is in almost prestine condition. Hopefully so are the contents of the armory it grants access to.
The unmistakable 'STARPORT' logo leaps out from the card. The smaller 'Top Floor Admin' whispers for your attention in pitiful subscript underneath.
A janitor's key loop with a single simple key with a cute broom charm attached; it appears to longingly sweep at the floor as it dangles from your hand
The keycard has an image of one of those rad looking 6-wheeler trucks printed on it with the text 'Garage Office' alongside it.
Labeled with 'Nutrion Farms' and is emblazoned the Nutrion Farms logo. It's still covered in a sickly stale pumpkin juice... ew.
Looks like the key to someone's house. The amount of rust and moss on it seems to imply its origin is somewhere deep in a jungle.
A bright white keycard with the telltale livery of Osiris. 'Pinnacle Labs' is laser etched professionally onto it.
A key to The Tipsy Drone attached to a miniature trinket of the namesakes affable drone mascot.
A key to what was once a more public space
A round green logo is barely visible under the muck that's grown over this keycard.
A key to the Osiris Office. Its owner sure won't be missing it...
A Key to the Korolev Quarry's Boss Office. Usually something good stashed away in such places.
A Key to the Korolev Surgery Room. There must have been a lot of injuries on the island for Korolev to set one up.
Osiris discovered the schematics for this strange key amongst the Cultist Ritual Items and figured out how to use alien materials to craft it. Not meant for any human locks.
A worn out backpack that doesn't seem to hold much.
